etymons.raw: unknown если мы не найдем ничего лучше, то cf. MEA lʕʕ, SL 695: to lick; lwʕ, SL 679: to lick; cf. Arab. lġw, Wehr 1158: sprechen

Preterit.turoyo: mlaʕele, omər baṭanno 415; prs 195/5; u=ḥa=yawmo aṯyo žənəke sawto, w faqərto, mlaʕela w ṭləbla meni, i=awday-aṯe 2/64;
translations: er bettelte und sagte: “Ich bin müde”
‘eines Tages kam eine alte, arme Frau und bat mich inständigst um dieses Zimmer’;

Infectum.turoyo: omər: "Ma lə gbatli u mašruqawo, gdobenux klabṯo?" Omər: "Bele, ašər, komilaʕeno. I klabṯo gəmḥamyo aʕ ʕezayḏi mad dewe." 2018_06_20_au_001_NE_Old_lady_n_bird: 43 komilaʕeno doṯeno koraxno ʕal i+tərto ‘I wish very much to come and look for the (lost) cow’ (Ilyas p.c.)
translations: '(The bird) said: "Won't you give me that flute, and I will give you a dog?" He said: "Yes of course, I beg you, a dog will protect my goats from wolves."'
